trashday

Class TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.speech.speechlet.lambda.SpeechletRequestStreamHandler
      • trashday.TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.amazonaws.services.lambda.runtime.RequestStreamHandler

    public class TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler
extends com.amazon.speech.speechlet.lambda.SpeechletRequestStreamHandler
    Ensure the Alexa request is intended for our service and pass it on to our TrashDaySpeechlet.

    This is mostly boilerplate code. However the constructor from a AmazonDynamoDBClient is added to allow the JUnit tests to use a local Dynamo DB instance for testing purposes only.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    J. Todd Baldwin
    See Also:
    Alexa Skills Kit Doc: Handling Requests Sent By Alexa

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler()
      Handle requests using the Amazon Dynamo DB cloud.
      TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler(com.amazonaws.services.dynamodbv2.AmazonDynamoDBClient db)
      Handle requests using a specified Dynamo DB.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class com.amazon.speech.speechlet.lambda.SpeechletRequestStreamHandler

        handleRequest

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler

        public TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler()
                                      throws IllegalStateException
        Handle requests using the Amazon Dynamo DB cloud. Used for normal Alexa skill requests.

        CoberturaIgnore directive used since we do not want to build JUnit tests that connect to the actual Amazon Dynamo DB cloud.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the environment does not define "applicationId" then this Alexa skill will not start.

      • TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler

        public TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler(com.amazonaws.services.dynamodbv2.AmazonDynamoDBClient db)
                                      throws IllegalStateException
        Handle requests using a specified Dynamo DB. Used only for JUnit tests at this time.
        Parameters:
        db - specific Dynamo DB (instead of the default Dynamo DB cloud)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the environment does not define "applicationId" then this Alexa skill will not start.
